description: Masterwort (Angelica atropurpurea) is an amazing plant that adds beauty and texture to any garden. This perennial herb has large clusters of striking, flat umbels of cream-colored flowers that bloom in summer, often with dark-purple, winged stems and lacy leaves. Its bright, showy flowers attract a variety of pollinators, such as bees, butterflies, and hummingbirds, making it a favorite among gardeners. It is also known for its unique scent that has sweet, herbal, and spicy tones, making it popular for use in perfumes. Masterwort is easy to care for, even in colder climates, and makes a great addition to any garden.
